name: Kepler-23
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-23 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-23 is a star with 1.9999999999999991 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.55 times its radius. It is located 2793.00 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-23 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-23 b

Kepler-23 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-05. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.11 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-23.

The mass of Kepler-23 b is 254.25 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-23 b is 1.9 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-23 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

Kepler-23 c

Kepler-23 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-05. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.74 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-23.

The mass of Kepler-23 c is 858.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-23 c is 3.2 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-23 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

Kepler-23 d

Kepler-23 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 15.27 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-23.

The mass of Kepler-23 d is 6.36 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-23 d is 2.2 that of Earth. At 6.36 Earth masses, Kepler-23 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-23, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
